title: Digital Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fine. Met two VPs through a Zoom meeting. What was not fine is the complete lack of response after the interview. In spite of repeated voicemails left and emails sent, the decision maker never once responded to let me know my status. How unprofessional!
Interview Questions: Nothing surprising. What is surprising is their complete lack of response.

title: Access Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: One round of interviews with all three managers. Conversation based and lasted about 30 minutes to 40 minutes. Overall smooth and quick process and enjoyed it. This interview seemed to be behavior-based.
Interview Questions: How will you balance your job with college life also?

title: Student Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at College of Wooster in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Excellent, great staff! Super friendly to talk too very approachable. Application, screening, technical assessment, interview (technical and social skills), questions, follow-up. Friendly staff, thorough evaluation of technical proficiency and interpersonal skills.
Interview Questions: what platforms are you most proficient on?

title: AMRE Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview is done by professors.  They will look at your resume and see what classes have you taken. If you get a good grade, you will have a good chance to get hired.
Interview Questions: What classes do you think is the most useful?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It required knowledge of some IT processes across campus. Requires you to be informed and have solid improvisation skills. Questions can range between knowing how the campus printer works, to how to do basic troubleshooting based on a scenario. I thoroughly enjoyed my work there.
Interview Questions: How do you help a student connect to a printer?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with both of my prospective supervisors for a quick 30-minute conversation that involved working through my resume and what the position would involve. They specifically asked about the (computer science/data analysis) skills that they were unfamiliar with.
Interview Questions: How do you think the position would compliment your academic interests?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at College of Wooster
Interview Descriptions: Group projects and individual interviews. Projects involve different activities, solving puzzles etc. testing teamwork capacities. Interviews involved answering questions around day to day activities etc. For group activities, past RAs, RDs and officers take notes. For interviews it's generally a sit down process where a team of 2-3 RDs/ADs take the interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you solve for conflicts in residents?

title: Visiting Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at College of Wooster
Interview Descriptions: They scheduled a Skype interview with me. A week later, they invited me to visit the college. I presented a lecture to a class and presented my research to the department. I also interviewed with each faculty member along with the provost of the college.
Interview Questions: What is your research?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: You had to apply with a completed application, submit a video introduction, and then wait for your face-to-face interview. The interview was about 10 minutes long. I had to do a creative introduction and presentation
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Digital Curation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at College of Wooster (Wooster, OH) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview took up 30 minutes. Very  straight forward was really interested in hiring someone with already good knowledge of programming and women in sport. Very friendly interviewer, tested some technical skills during the interview which threw me off a little
Interview Questions: What do you know about women in sports
